page.title: 08ST. MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: The only church in the area is St. Mary the Virgin in Little Sampford.It lies in the s/east of the parish, amidst trees,looking over cornfields. Walls made from flint and pebble rubble.South porch, red and blue brick with dressing of limestone and clunch. A lead roof.The church is fourteenth century.Chancel east window is late fifteenth century.Extensive repairs to window done recently and completed this year.Dark plastic sheets covered window the past two years until sufficient money for repairs was raised.Builders from Cambridge did the repairs.Cleaning of the church and minor repairs to the fabric are done by the parishioners. The Rev.Mark Glasswell Ph.D. was appointed Rector of the combined Sampford parishes on return to England after twenty years service in West Africa.
